meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by inertia.
meanings.sent1: The car's inertial motion kept it moving forward even after the engine stopped.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the inertial properties of the object to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat showed an inertial response when called for dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had an inertial resistance to change, clinging to familiar routines.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rock's inertial force made it difficult to lift.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the force of inertia.
meanings.sent1: The inertial force of the moving train made it hard to change its speed.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut experienced the effects of inertial forces during the rocket launch.
meanings.sent3: The inertial pull of the magnet attracted the metal objects nearby.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness had an inertial impact on the team's progress.
meanings.sent5: The inertial resistance of the boulder made it challenging to push uphill.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to remain in a fixed position.
meanings.sent1: The inertial chair stayed in the corner of the room, untouched for years.
meanings.sent2: The old tree had an inertial presence in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent3: The inertial clock on the wall always showed the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: Her inertial behavior at work made it hard for her to adapt to new tasks.
meanings.sent5: The inertial nature of the mountain made it a challenge for climbers to conquer.
